info.description: llamactl is a control server for managing Llama Server instances.
info.title: llamactl API

get.description: Returns a list of all API keys for the system user (excludes key hash and plain-text key)

post.description: Creates a new API key with the specified permissions and returns the plain-text key (only shown once)
post.summary: Create a new API key

201.description: Created API key with plain-text key

400.description: Invalid request body or validation error

get.description: Returns details for a specific API key by ID (excludes key hash and plain-text key)
get.summary: Get details of a specific API key

delete.description: Deletes an API key by ID

get.description: Returns the instance-level permissions for a specific API key (includes instance names)
Returns a list of available devices for the llama server
get.summary: List available devices for llama server

get.description: Returns the help text for the llama server command

post.description: Parses a llama-server command string into instance options
post.summary: Parse llama-server command

get.description: Returns the version of the llama server command

post.description: Parses MLX-LM server command string into instance options
post.summary: Parse mlx_lm.server command

post.description: Parses a vLLM serve command string into instance options
post.summary: Parse vllm serve command

get.description: Returns a list of all instances managed by the server
Returns the details of a specific instance by name
get.summary: Get details of a specific instance

put.description: Updates the configuration of a specific instance by name

post.description: Creates a new instance with the provided configuration options
post.summary: Create and start a new instance

delete.description: Stops and removes a specific instance by name

get.description: Returns the logs from a specific instance by name with optional line limit
get.summary: Get logs from a specific instance

parameters.description: Number of lines to retrieve (default: all lines)
parameters.name: lines

400.description: Invalid name format or lines parameter

get.description: Forwards HTTP requests to the llama-server instance running on a specific port
get.summary: Proxy requests to a specific instance, does not autostart instance if stopped

post.description: Forwards HTTP requests to the llama-server instance running on a specific port
post.summary: Proxy requests to a specific instance, does not autostart instance if stopped

post.description: Restarts a specific instance by name
post.summary: Restart a running instance

post.description: Starts a specific instance by name
post.summary: Start a stopped instance

post.description: Stops a specific instance by name
post.summary: Stop a running instance

get.description: Returns a list of models available in the specified llama.cpp instance
get.summary: List models in a llama.cpp instance

post.description: Loads the specified model in the given llama.cpp instance
post.summary: Load a model in a llama.cpp instance

post.description: Unloads the specified model in the given llama.cpp instance
post.summary: Unload a model in a llama.cpp instance

get.description: Returns a map of all nodes configured in the server (node name -> node config)
Returns the details of a specific node by name
get.summary: Get details of a specific node

get.description: Returns the version of the llamactl command
Proxies requests to the llama.cpp UI for the specified instance
get.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp UI for the instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

get.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
get.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

get.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
get.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Proxies requests to the specified llama.cpp server instance, starting it on-demand if configured
post.summary: Proxy requests to llama.cpp server instance

post.description: Handles all POST requests to /v1/*, routing to the appropriate instance based on the request body. Requires API key authentication via the `Authorization` header.
post.summary: OpenAI-compatible proxy endpoint

400.description: Invalid request body or instance name

get.description: Returns a list of instances in a format compatible with OpenAI API

data_dir.description: Directory where all llamactl data will be stored (database, instances, logs, etc.)

management_keys.description: List of keys for management endpoints

require_inference_auth.description: Require authentication for OpenAI compatible inference endpoints

path.description: Database file path (relative to the top-level data_dir or absolute)

auto_create_dirs.description: Automatically create the data directory if it doesn't exist

default_auto_restart.description: Default auto-restart setting for new instances

default_max_restarts.description: Default max restarts for new instances

default_on_demand_start.description: Default on-demand start setting for new instances

default_restart_delay.description: Default restart delay for new instances (in seconds)

enable_lru_eviction.description: Enable LRU eviction for instance logs

logRotationCompress.description: Whether to compress rotated log files

logRotationMaxSize.description: Maximum log file size in MB before rotation

logs_dir.description: Logs directory override (relative to data_dir if not absolute)

max_instances.description: Maximum number of instances that can be created

max_running_instances.description: Maximum number of instances that can be running at the same time

on_demand_start_timeout.description: How long to wait for an instance to start on demand (in seconds)

timeout_check_interval.description: Interval for checking instance timeouts (in minutes)

enable_swagger.description: Enable Swagger UI for API documentation

response_headers.description: Response headers to send with responses

created.description: Unix timestamp when instance was created
